result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The original history event date is: 04-14-2022
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felon possessing firearm, carry handgun where alcohol is sold or consumed, disorderly conduct with use of dangerous weapon, receive stolen property, 2 counts felony bail jumping, 4 counts misdemeanor bail jumping, carry concealed weapon and 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety .  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 04-18-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with the victim, J.S., DOB: 01-03-1985, except incidental contact at place of employment, no contact with the Fireside Pub in Two Rivers, WI and maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
